intro: Tithymalus variegatus, commonly known as the variegated tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are often variegated with white or cream markings, adding to its ornamental value. Tithymalus variegatus is valued in horticulture for its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in partial shade.
